metadata.title: CVE-2022-49020 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/9p: Fix a potential socket leak in p9_socket_openBoth p9_fd_create_tcp() and p9_fd_create_unix() will callp9_socket_open(). If the creation of p9_trans_fd fails,p9_fd_create_tcp() and p9_fd_create_unix() will return anerror directly instead of releasing the cscoket, which willresult in a socket leak.This patch adds sock_release() to fix the leak issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-49020` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1').
